meanings.definition: To broadcast a program on television using cable.
meanings.sent1: The local news station will cablecast the weather report tonight.
meanings.sent2: They cablecasted the live concert to viewers across the city.
meanings.sent3: I cablecasted my cat's antics on TV for a good laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her voice cablecasted a sense of calm and reassurance to the audience.
meanings.sent5: The cablecast of the sports event made it feel like we were right there in the stadium.

meanings.definition: A program broadcast on television using cable.
meanings.sent1: We missed the cablecast of our favorite show last night.
meanings.sent2: The cablecast of the documentary was informative and engaging.
meanings.sent3: The cablecast of the cooking competition made us all hungry!
meanings.sent4: The cablecast of the movie drew in a large audience of movie buffs.
meanings.sent5: The cablecast of the music awards showcased talented artists from around the world.
